snippet: The attack was one of several violent episodes across the country, which some attributed to an uptick in clashes between Turkish security forces and Kurdish militants.
abstract: Gunmen open fire outside United States Consulate in Istanbul, setting off gun battle with Turkish police; no Americans or police forces are wounded; Revolutionary People's Liberation Party-Front, anti-American and Marxist group, takes responsibility; attack is one of four across country executed by group and Kurdistan Workers' Party, part of increased violence in wake of Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's initializing major counterterrorism effort, which critics say is bid to consolidate political power.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Mugla, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The attack was one of several violent episodes across the country, which some attributed to an uptick in clashes between Turkish security forces and Kurdish militants.

headline.main: Attackers in Istanbul Open Fire Outside U.S. Consulate
headline.print_headline: Gun Battle Erupts Outside U.S. Consulate in Istanbul

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
